marginalia.translation: These points. The fifth essence of words and deeds.

position.marginalia_text: Vt quodq[ue] est aptissimu[m], agillimumq[ue] ingenium; ita in Singulis proficit celerrimè.

marginalia.translation: When anything of genius is most fitting and most agile, so it succeeds in singular endeavors most rapidly.

position.marginalia_text: Citò discit, et statim operatur animus diuinus. Quicquid imperauit animus, obtinuit.
Serius, solidusq[ue] artifex statim capit, quod sapit maximè.
In grauibus, meras Gnomas loquitur, aut Leges: In acribus, mera apophthegmata, aut Stratagemata: In lepidis, meras Ironias, aut Sales.

marginalia.translation: In serious matters, one speaks only in gnomic phrases; in subtle matters, only in aphorisms or stratagems; in pleasant matters, only with irony or wit.

position.marginalia_text: Nihil peritius, subtilius, aut profundius. Nihil efficacius, aut potentius. Prudentia, ars viuendi: fortitudo, praxis.

marginalia.translation: Nothing is more experienced, more subtle, or more profound. Nothing more effective, or more potent. Prudence, the art of living: strength, praxis.
